00150 /*
00151 
00152 
00154 
00155 CODEC DEFINITION
00156 
00157         Sample rate = samples/sec (ex. 8000)
00158         Sample size = bits (ex. 16 bits)
00159         Sample endianness = le/be
00160 
00161         Sample compressor = name
00162 
00163         <rate>:<bits>:<endianness>:<compressor>
00164 
00165         8000:16:le:null
00166         8000:16:le:gsm
00167         8000:16:le:adpcm
00168

00189 KviVoiceParty::KviVoiceParty(const QString &szNick,const QString &szIp,unsigned short uPort)
00190 : m_szIp(szIp), m_uPort(uPort), m_szNick(szNick)
00191 {

00200 void KviVoiceParty::addChild(KviVoiceParty * pChild)
00201 {
00202         if(!m_pChildrenTree)
00203         {
00204                 m_pChildrenTree = new KviPointerList<KviVoiceParty>;
00205                 m_pChildrenTree->setAutoDelete(true);
00206         }
00207         m_pChildrenTree->append(pChild);
00208 }

00245 KviVoiceLink::KviVoiceLink(KviVoiceParty * pRemoteParty)
00246 {
00247         KviQString::sprintf("%Q:%u",&(pRemoteParty->nick()),pRemoteParty->port());
00248         m_pRemoteParty = pRemoteParty;
00249         m_pAudioEncoder = 0;
00250         m_pAudioDecoder = 0;

00254 {
00255         delete m_pRemoteParty;
00256         if(m_pAudioEncoder)delete m_pAudioEncoder;
00257         if(m_pAudioDecoder)delete m_pAudioDecoder;

00347 bool KviVoiceConference::setupUdpSocket()

00350 }

00353 {
00354 }
00355 
00356 void KviVoiceConference::conferenceThreadMain()
00357 {
00358         for(;;)
00359         {
00360                 readAndDecompressIncomingDataForEveryLink();
00361 
00362                 mixIncomingDataToASingleStream();
00363                 playIncomingDataSingleStream();
00364 
00365                 readLocalAudioStream();
00366 
00367                 foreach(link)
00368                 {
00369                         mixLocalAndOtherIncomingDataStreams()
00370                         compressAndSendOtherIncomingDataStreams()
00371                 }
00372 
00373         }
00374 }
00375 
00376 void KviVoiceConference::conferenceThread()
00377 {
00378         if(!setupUdpSocket())return;
00379 
00380         conferenceThreadMain();
00381 
00382         shutdownUdpSocket();
00383 }
00384 
00386 
00387 */
00388 
00389 // DCC VOICE NG proto
00390 
00391 //
00392 // tcp control connection
00393 //     --> HELLO: DccVoice protocol header
00394 //     <-- HELLO: DccVoice protocol header
00395 //     --> IACCEPT: Codec-description|CodecId,Codec-description|CodecID,Codec... (in order of preference)
00396 //     <-- IACCEPT: Codec-description|CodecID,Codec-description|CodecId,Codec... (in order of preference)
00397 //     --> MYADDRESS
00398 //     <-- MYADDRESS
00399 //     --> YOURIDIS: <local id for the remote end> (CID)
00400 //     <-- YOURIDIS: <local id for the remote end> (CID)
00401 
00402 // Audio is sent in blocks broken in chunks broken in udp packets
00403 // Each block is a set of consecutive audio chunks that theoretically
00404 // should be played consecutively.
00405 // Each packet in a chunk has an ordinal
00406 // Chunks must be relatively short in order
00407 //   to allow a remote end that looses a packet to
00408 //   synchronize after a short period of time
00409 //   The maximum number of packets in a chunk is 65535 (but a chunk should be no more than 24-32 KBytes in size
00410 //   and in general they should be as small as possible, even one packet per chunk, if the codec allows it)
00411 //   Each chunk should be encoded independently of the others
00412 //   We can switch codec at each chunk (but not at each packet)
00413 // When some packets are lost we loose the entire chunk
00414 // A block is completly synchronized in time (unless we loose some chunks: in that case
00415 // we may decide to synchronize with silence or insert a glitch...)
00416 // Decoding never depends on the future
00417 
00418 // Each packet should be decompressable (eventually dependently on the previous in the chunk)
00419 // but playable independently
00420 
00421 // start UDP stream
00422 
00423 // UDP Packet format:
00424 
00425 // <magic byte>: byte
00426 // <magic byte>: byte
00427 // <local id>: word
00428 // <payload len>: word
00429 // <payload>
00430 
00431 
00432 // Payload format:
00433 
00434 // <codec id>: word
00435 // <ordinal in a chunk>: word (0 = beginning of a chunk)
00436 
00437 // read raw audio data at sample rate X, sample size Y
00438 // multiplex data always at this sample rate and sample size
00439 
00440 
00441 #endif
00442 
00443 #endif //_VOICE_H_
